paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 variant T634S, including clinical significance, functional data, and penetrance information.

patients.phenotype: LQT2 phenotype potentially due to trafficking defect

individual_records.phenotype_details: LQT2 phenotype potentially due to trafficking defect
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A second mutation (T634A) has been reported in an adolescent LQTS patient diagnosed by a school-based screening program.

functional_data.summary: The T634S mutation leads to a marked loss of hERG channel function due to impaired trafficking.

variants.additional_notes: The T634S variant is characterized as a rescuable trafficking defective mutation.
key_quotes: This study was undertaken to elucidate the functional consequences of a variant of uncertain significance, T634S.
In conclusion, these data identify hERG-T634S as a rescuable trafficking defective mutation that reduces IKr sufficiently to delay repolarization and, thereby, potentially produce a LQT2 phenotype.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a specific variant in KCNH2.
